title: Source: Saints, Kamara agree on 2-year extension
description: The New Orleans Saints have agreed to a two-year extension with running back Alvin Kamara, a source told ESPN on Tuesday, confirming a report, an agreement that is worth approximately $24.5 million for the veteran who has 438 rushing yards this season.
author: Katherine Terrell
excerpt: The New Orleans Saints have agreed to a two-year extension with running back Alvin Kamara, a source told ESPN on Tuesday, confirming a report, an agreement that is worth approximately $24.5 million for the veteran who has 438 rushing yards this season.
text: Alvin Kamara goes off for 3 TDs in the 1st half vs. Cowboys (1:06)Alvin Kamara cooks the Cowboys for three touchdowns in the first half. html:
• Katherine Terrell, ESPN Staff WriterOct 22, 2024, 08:15 PM ET

    Close

      Katherine Terrell came back to ESPN to cover the New Orleans Saints in the summer of 2022. She left the company in 2019 after joining in 2016 to cover the Cincinnati Bengals. Katherine is a graduate of LSU and a Baton Rouge, Louisiana, native, and she has covered the NFL since 2013. You can follow Katherine on Twitter: @Kat_Terrell

NEW ORLEANS -- The New Orleans Saints have agreed to a two-year extension with running back Alvin Kamara, a source told ESPN on Tuesday, confirming a report.

The extension is worth approximately $24.5 million, the source said.

Kamara was the last major contract the Saints had not restructured or addressed. Kamara did not attend mandatory minicamp because of his contract but went through training camp as normal and said he was willing to play the season without a new deal.

Kamara has 111 carries for 438 yards and six touchdowns this season. He also has 34 receptions for 252 yards and another score.

Kamara recently denied trade rumors and said on X that he would like to finish his career in New Orleans.

The NFL Network first reported news of the agreement.
